oracle.cloud.storage
Interface EncryptedCloudStorage

All Superinterfaces:
CloudStorage
All Known Implementing Classes:
EncryptedCloudStorageImpl, MockStorageImpl
public interface EncryptedCloudStorage
extends CloudStorage

A CloudStorage class with support for client-side transparent data encryption using a technique called "envelope encryption".

A unique symmetric key is generated by this Java client for every stored Object. This symmetric key is used to encrypt Object data. The symmetric key is then encrypted with the provided KeyPair and stored alongside the Object data. This encrypted key is known as the envelope key. When accessing Object data with the Java client the envelope key is retrieved and decrypted with the originally provided KeyPair. The Object data is decrypted with the originally generated symmetric key.

To re-encrypted Object data the Java client provides a method to rotate the originally provided KeyPair with a new KeyPair.

Author:
Copyright (c) 2013, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

getKeyPair

Returns:

rotateEncryptionKey

void rotateEncryptionKey(java.lang.String container,
                         java.lang.String key,
                         java.security.PrivateKey decryptionKey)
Re-encrypt an already encrypted Object with a new KeyPair. The original KeyPair must be provided for this operation.

Parameters:
container - the Container name
key - the Object key
decryptionKey - the private key required to decrypt the specified Object
